TITLE: 'The 355' is loaded with star power but adds up to less than the sum of its parts

SUMMARY: A cruise ship heading to Miami changed course to the Bahamas Saturday after a US judge issued an arrest warrant for the ship due to unpaid fuel bills.

On Thursday, Ford will stop accepting any new retail orders for the 2022 model year Maverick, company spokesman Michael Levine said in an email. After that, buyers will have to wait until order banks open for the 2023 model year this summer.

He adds, "My thinking is this: After four distinct surges, each with a lead viral variant, why would there not be five?" TITLE: My book was banned. Here's how we fought back
SUMMARY: I got the news on Twitter—someone told me that our kids books, "I am Rosa Parks" and "I am Martin Luther King, Jr." had been banned. Can't be, I thought. But it was true. In Pennsylvania, after the Central York School District's diversity education committee recommended 200-plus books as anti-racist resources, the school board vetoed the entire list in November 2020. The list included books by Malala Yousafzai, an adaptation of "Hidden Figures," a Sesame Street book about racism, and yes, books written by me and illustrated by Chris Eliopoulos on Rosa Parks and Dr. Martin Luther King. Central York School Board members called the reading list "divisive" and "bad ideas."

TITLE: Longtime NFL reporter John Clayton, known as 'The Professor,' has died at age 67
SUMMARY: Longtime NFL reporter John Clayton, who was known as "The Professor" because of his encyclopedic knowledge of the game, died Friday, according to both ESPN, where he was an analyst, and Seattle Sports, where he hosted a radio show.

TITLE: For all the new tech aspects of Ukraine coverage, some of the most powerful moments come from tried-and-true journalism
SUMMARY: As much as we like to focus on what's new in media, information and war coverage in our analyses, we should not forget what is old and can still be great in battlefield journalism.

TITLE: Ukraine refugees: Why the US has allowed so few
SUMMARY: More than 3 million Ukrainians have fled their country since Russia's invasion, with nearly 2 million pouring into neighboring Poland and hundreds of thousands going to other nearby countries. But very few have come to the US. It's a story of red tape and a broken immigration system.

TITLE: From New York to Florida, severe storms, including isolated tornadoes, are possible Saturday
SUMMARY: The same damaging storm system that rolled across the Southeast on Friday will continue this weekend, impacting over 50 million people along the East Coast.

TITLE: Teachers in a US military town are drawing straight lines from their classrooms to a war zone 4,500 miles away
SUMMARY: Students at Watertown High School worried the world is on the brink of World War III. Their teacher asked them to examine media influence and economic forces at play in the conflict, hoping they'd find insights -- and rest their uneasy minds.

TITLE: Where the US stands on Covid-19 vaccines for children under 5
SUMMARY: A month after the US Food and Drug Administration delayed key steps toward authorizing Covid-19 vaccines for children under 5, many parents are more eager for the shots than ever.

TITLE: F1 2022 season preview: New designs, new drivers but one familiar rivalry
SUMMARY: For the first time since the dawn of the Mercedes era -- the team has now won eight consecutive constructors' championships -- there is genuine uncertainty about how the Formula One season will unfold, with the Bahrain Grand Prix on Sunday kicking off the new campaign.

TITLE: Paulo Fonseca: Former Roma manager shares family escape story from Ukraine
SUMMARY: They were woken in the early hours by the sound of bombs landing within earshot of their apartment in Kyiv. Like many others, they fled Ukraine, setting off on a perilous journey to safety.

TITLE: Mike Tyson is selling ear-shaped cannabis-infused edibles called 'Mike Bites'
SUMMARY: More than two decades after Mike Tyson bit off a chunk of Evander Holyfield's ear at the 1997 WBA Heavyweight Championship fight, the legendary boxer has released a line of edibles -- in the shape of ears.

TITLE: 4 US service members killed after aircraft crashes in Norway, PM says
SUMMARY: Four US service members were killed when the aircraft they were traveling in crashed during NATO training exercises in Norway, the country's Prime Minister said Saturday.

TITLE: The destinations dropping all Covid rules for entry and more of the latest in travel
SUMMARY: This week at CNN Travel, we look at the countries dropping all their Covid-related rules for entry, innovative airplane cabin designs, new breathtaking bridges and why Finland is living its best life.

TITLE: How aid organizations are responding to the crisis in Ukraine -- inside the country, at the border and beyond
SUMMARY: In the parking lot of a refugee reception center just inside Poland, Ukrainian women spoke last week with a bus driver as aid worker Chris Skopec stood nearby.

TITLE: Lucrative Saudi-backed golf league is 'new opportunity' for players, says CEO Greg Norman
SUMMARY: The new lucrative Saudi Arabia-backed golf league is a "new opportunity" for players and the sport, according to its chairman Greg Norman.

TITLE: Budweiser's slogan wasn't always the 'King of Beers'
SUMMARY: Budweiser's slogan, the "King of Beers," is as recognizable as its Clydesdales. But it wasn't always those exact words.

TITLE: Oregon man wins $8.9 million from forgotten lottery ticket he bought on Christmas
SUMMARY: Nearly three months after buying a Megabucks lottery ticket and quickly forgetting about it, an Oregon man is a multimillionaire.

TITLE: 'Fashioning Masculinities:' Tracing the history of gender-fluid menswear
SUMMARY: A new exhibition about the history of masculine dressing reveals that menswear has always been more fluid than fixed.

TITLE: How Kohl's became such a mess
SUMMARY: In 2018, Kohl's was a bright spot in the beleaguered department store sector.

TITLE: Why March is so volatile for stocks
SUMMARY: March Madness isn't just for college basketball fans. That phrase is also an apt description of the volatility on Wall Street, and this March is no different.

TITLE: Maryland lawmakers move to ban veterinarians from declawing cats
SUMMARY: Maryland is one step closer to becoming the second US state to ban the declawing of cats.

TITLE: Amy Schumer reckons with older millennial malaise in 'Life & Beth'
SUMMARY: In "Life & Beth," Amy Schumer plays a woman who looks to live her best life. Schumer gives us a warm and sweet comedy as only she can — with her irreverent wit.

TITLE: How Ketanji Brown Jackson is preparing for questions about her record on crime
SUMMARY: Like most every other nominee for the Supreme Court, Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson has been participating behind closed doors in so-called "moot court" sessions to prepare for her upcoming hearings, according to a source familiar.

TITLE: What 'WeCrashed' and 'The Dropout' tell us
SUMMARY: Shows like 'The Dropout,' 'WeCrashed' and 'Super Pumped' are part of an office culture canon that stretches from Herman Melville's 'Bartleby, the Scrivener' to 'The Office,' writes Nicole Hemmer. In their explorations of fraud and workplace abuse, these shows also critique the new economy -- even as they remind us there's no escape from it.

TITLE: Prosecutors vowed 2 years ago to examine singer James Brown's death. Newly released documents show they did very little
SUMMARY: A woman told prosecutors in Atlanta in 2020 she thought James Brown had been murdered. The DA vowed to investigate. Two years later, the inquiry is dead -- and potential evidence is missing.

TITLE: Black therapists are struggling to be seen on TikTok. They're forming their own communities instead
SUMMARY: It can be tough for Black therapists to get exposure on TikTok. They work to create safe communities for people of color to learn more about mental health and get resources for help outside the app.

TITLE: Biden's strategy with Putin is decades in the making
SUMMARY: Joe Biden always says foreign relations is about relationships, and he's been developing the one he has with Vladimir Putin for two decades.

TITLE: US defense secretary Lloyd Austin tells CNN Russia made 'missteps' in Ukraine invasion
SUMMARY: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin on Friday said that the US has "seen a number of missteps" by Russia in its invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: Indiana health officials testing water, air quality after fire at Walmart distribution center
SUMMARY: Public health officials in Indiana are urging people to take safety precautions after a large fire at a Walmart distribution center in Plainfield this week released thick smoke containing high levels of fine particulate material.

TITLE: Artemis I moon rocket is a step closer to launch countdown
SUMMARY: Marvel at NASA's mega moon rocket and Orion spacecraft as they roll out to the launchpad, learn about gigantic sinkholes discovered in the Artic seafloor, take a guess at how researchers are luring murder hornets into traps, and investigate more this week.

TITLE: Russians were go-to movie villains in the 1980s. What a new Cold War might bring
SUMMARY: How will the promise of a second Cold War impact the portrayal of Russia in movies and television? To see a glimpse of what could be in the future it's worth looking to the past.

TITLE: People in Mariupol risking lives each time they leave shelter, says Ukrainian army commander
SUMMARY: People in the Ukrainian city of Mariupol risk their lives each time they emerge from underground bunkers, a local military official said, claiming the strategic port is facing the most intense fighting anywhere in the country.
